title: Liverpool FC Melwood picture special | Daily Mail Online
text: comments The times are a-changing at Liverpool. England's must successful club have confirmed they are leaving their historic Melwood training ground to take up residence at their academy in Kirkby. Kirkby Academy is to be transformed into a £50million state-of-the-art complex for both the first team and youth set-ups, with the club set to purchase 14 acres of land at Simonswood playing fields to expand the current site to around 60 acres. Melwood has been Liverpool's training base since the 1950s but under the plans announced on Wednesday, it will be sold off for 160 family homes. The move to Kirkby is expected to be completed by 2019. Sportsmail look back at how the iconic training ground has evolved over the years, from the early days under Bill Shankly to the present day and Jurgen Klopp... Bill Shankly (manager), Bob Paisley (assistant manager), Joe Fagan (first team trainer), Ronnie Moran (second team trainer), Reuben Bennett (special duties) and Tom Saunders (youth trainer) pose at Melwood in July 1971 Former Liverpool winger Peter Thompson lifts a weight during training inside Melwood in 1970. The England international made 426 appearances during a decade of service on Merseyside Liverpool first-team boss Bob Paisley goes through tactics during a team-talk at Melwood in 1983, a year in which the Reds won the First Division and the League Cup A handful of supporters watch Liverpool's first-team train at Melwood in 1983 during a cloudy day on Merseyside Liverpool's European Cup-winning goalkeeper Bruce Grobbelaar clowns around during a training session at Melwood in 1983 (Left-right) Liverpool stars Steve McManaman, Rob Jones, Stan Collymore and Jason McAteer mimic the Beatles as they unveil a new ecru away kit in 1996 at Melwood. Liverpool earned the nickname The Spice Boys during the 90s (Foreground, left-right) Steven Gerrard, Danny Murphy, Robbie Fowler, Gary McAllister and Nicky Barmby are put through their paces during pre-season training in August 2000 Nicky Barmby leads the way as the Liverpool players prepare for the start of a season in which they went on to win a cup treble Liverpool's then record £14m striker Djibril Ciise leans on crutches after suffering a horrific leg break during a draw against Blackburn Rovers in November 2004 A group of Liverpool fans use roadworks barriers to catch a glimpse of the first-team training ahead of the Champions League semi-final second-leg win over Chelsea in May 2005 Liverpool manager Rafa Benitez talks tactics with captain Steven Gerrard during a training session in September 2005 Melwood was used as a training base by England during the years the national team toured the country while Wembley was re-developed. Here Jermain Defoe, Joe Cole, John Terry and Shaun Wright-Phillips prepare for a clash with Uruguay at Anfield Benitez leads a Liverpool training session ahead of a Champions League clash with Benfica in March 2006 Liverpool's players are put through their paces ahead of a Champions League clash during the 2006-07 season Liverpool players including Steve Finnan (left), Dirk Kuyt (front, second left), John-Arne Riise (front, centre), Steven Gerrard (second right) and Fernando Torres (right) are put through their paces during the 2007-08 season Rafa Benitez poses with Liverpool's new £19m signing Robbie Keane from Tottenham in July 2008. The Irishman was sold back to Spurs in February 2009 after a disappointing spell on Merseyside Children climb on step-ladders and garden furniture to catch a glimpse of their Liverpool heroes training in April 2009 Steven Gerrard jogs on a treadmill at Melwood as he exchanges a joke with Liverpool's new signing Glen Johnson in July 2009 Fernando Torres poses with the Barclays Player of the month Trophy for September 2009 on a sunny autumn day at Melwood Jamie Carragher leads the way during a training session at Melwood, closely followed by Philipp Degen and Glen Johnson Rafa Benitez issues a team-talk to his Liverpool squad ahead of a Champions League home clash with Lyon in October 2009. The Reds would lose 2-1 on their way to a group-stage exit in the competition Liverpool striker Fernando Torres is all smiles as he begins a snowball fight at a wintry Melwood in January 2010 (Left-right) Albert Riera, Alberto Aquilani, Dirk Kuyt and Martin Skrtel join in the fun during a snowball fight in January 2010 Glen Johnson, Steven Gerrard, Daniel Agger and Jamie Carragher train on exercise bikes during pre-season in 2010 Liverpool striker Fernando Torres tests his upper-body strength in the gym having returned for pre-season injured in 2010 Spanish goalkeeper Pepe Reina is put through his paces by Liverpool sports scientist Jordan Milsom in August 2010 Sportsmail columnist Jamie Carragher tests his balance while leaning on an exercise ball during a training session Liverpool owners John Henry and Tom Werner walk through Melwood for the first time after completing their £300million takeover of the club following a bitter legal battle with Tom Hicks and George Gillett in October 2010 A group of Liverpool fans look on as the Liverpool squad gather for a training session while Sammy Lee issues instructions Luis Suarez poses for a photo in the boot room at Melwood after completing his move from Ajax in January 2011. The Uruguayan went on to score 82 goals in 133 appearances for the Reds Jurgen Klopp smiles as he oversees training alongside Ben Woodburn, Joel Matip, Nathaniel Clyne and Alberto Moreno Nathaniel Clyne and Sadio Mane running after the news broke that Liverpool were to leave their historic training ground RELATED ARTICLES
